review_title: Unsafe patient ratios, understaffing, bullying culture
pros: As a PA, ORMC provides an extremely high amount of responsibility and autonomy. I enjoy the depth of my practice at this hospital, however wish that we had support from attendings and administration when the acuity or patient load is too high.
cons: Throughout the hospital, in every department and across disciplines (medicine, nursing, etc) we are critically understaffed. On raising concerns about unsafe patient to provider ratios, my concerns were dismissed and I was refused additional help. There is also culture of bullying in place at ORMC, and employees are not treated as through they are valued after the first few months of 'honeymoon phase' in employment. It is more common than not that PA staff are kept overtime for sign out or to finish work because it is not possible to accomplish during the course of a shift, or attending physicians appear to work late.

pros: The best reasons to work for ORMC are the close knit environment and the skills you can learn here. The people are absolutely great at ORMC, especially the Arden Hill campus. Its very easy to make friends and get to know people on a personal basis which helps take away the stress and rigours of the day. Since its a large multi facility hospital, there are always plenty of things to learn. As an IT worker, you have to learn lots of different systems that must integrate with each other yet are sometimes so disparate and specialized that no one knows them very well. Every day there is a chance to learn new things which also helps to stave off boredom and monotony.
cons: I would say that the biggest downside working at ORMC is the lack of pay. As the county's largest employer aside from the government, they really set the scales as to who gets paid what. For most job classes, especially in IT, its far below what the national average is. Going back to how you constantly learn new things at ORMC, this is also a curse. You learn so much and take on so much more responsibility that you quickly outpace your job title and pay level. This and the fact that raises and promotions are so hard to come by makes it a frustrating place to work.

pros: Great support for staff (most of the time), great salary and benefits, clean, modern.  Doctors and nurses work well together.
cons: High nurse/patient ratios within med/surg units.  Food in the cafeteria is VERY expensive, even with the employee discount.  For such a modern facility, wish there was a gym/work out room for staff like many newer hospitals offer for their employees.
